name: Fiddlers' Green [Mini!]
description:
You've woken up trapped in a pocket of the Fiddlers' Green, a realm somewhere between fae partyground and cheerful afterlife. But you're nowhere near the party, and you don't feel all too cheerful either - in fact, it seems you've been locked here . . .

This itty bitty color-matching game was made for the Mini Jam 111: Colors² over a single weekend!

It was made entirely in TyranoBuilder, so also served as a fun exercise of trying to build a little puzzle game using that engine. While the game should run fine in-browser, it'll definitely run faster if you download & play locally. Enjoy!

An answer key to all levels is included in the dowloadable version's files, and as a post in the devlog section of this webpage! Answers are given in percentages; one click of a color is +25%.
There are some known bugs:

  • if dialogue isn't progressing when you click, try using the spacebar instead.
  • if dialogue disappears, try scrolling up or down - should bring it back!

If you've enjoyed, consider donating so we at Featherboy Press can continue jamming.

Content Warnings:

Spooky vibes; No gore, but frequent mentions of bloods.

Credits:

Featherboy Press
Art, Writing, Code, and Audio Editing by Benjamin Feinstein.
